      • Serialized Fields

        • bullet

          int bullet
          This field represents additional bullet, which can be picked up by the player. Its initial value is 1. It's only effective when the player has no bullet.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -3272087268948950876L

      • Serialized Fields

        • front

          java.lang.String front
          This field represents the front side of an GameEntity.

        • back

          java.lang.String back
          This field represents the back side of an GameEntity.

        • row

          int row
          This field represents the row index number of an GameEntity.

        • column

          int column
          This field represents the column index number of an GameEntity.

        • isFlipped

          boolean isFlipped
          This field represents whether an GameEntity is flipped or not. If it's true, it shows the front side; otherwise, it shows the back side.

        • attack

          boolean attack
          This field represents whether or not an GameEntity attacks. If it's true, then the GameEntity attacks;, otherwise, it does not attack. This is only shared with Player and Enemy classes.

        • playerUp

          boolean playerUp

        • playerDown

          boolean playerDown

        • playerRight

          boolean playerRight

        • playerLeft

          boolean playerLeft

        • hardModePlayerNotFound

          boolean hardModePlayerNotFound

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.Invincibility extends edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      6479307966170482598L

      • Serialized Fields

        • numberOfTurns

          int numberOfTurns
          The player will be invincible for 5 turns. The initial value is 6 because as soon as the player consumes it, it goes down by 1.

          edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity[] holdPowerUps
          This field represents an GameEntity array which holds all the power-ups.

        • bulletIndicator

          boolean bulletIndicator
          This field represents whether or not the player found the additional bullet. Its initial value is false.

        • radarIndicator

          boolean radarIndicator
          This field represents whether or not the player found the radar. Its initial value is false.

        • invincibleIndicator

          boolean invincibleIndicator
          This field represents whether or not the player found the invincibility. Its initial value is false.

        • briefCaseIndicator

          boolean briefCaseIndicator
          This field represents whether or not the player found the briefcase. Its initial value is false.

        • foundPlayer

          boolean foundPlayer
          This field represents whether or not an enemy found the player. Its initial value is false.

        • playerAttack

          boolean playerAttack
          This field represents whether or not player can attack.

        • ableEnemyAttack

          boolean ableEnemyAttack
          This field depends on the invincibility power-up. When the player consumes the invincibility power-up, this field's value becomes false in order to disable enemyAttack method. Otherwise, it stays as true.

        • northSideOfRoom

          boolean northSideOfRoom
          This field represents whether or not the player is located on northside of a room.

        • hardMode

          boolean hardMode
          This field represents whether or not the game is in hard mode. True means hard mode and false mean normal mode.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.Player extends edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_assgmnt_final.GameEntity implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -2119382567041410642L

      • Serialized Fields

        • life

          int life
          This field represents the initial life points that player will start with, which is 3.

        • bullet

          int bullet
          This field represent the bullet. The player starts with one bullet. The maximum is 1.

        • attack

          boolean attack
          This field represents whether or not the player can attack, if the player has a bullet = true; otherwise, false.

        • dangerAhead

          boolean dangerAhead
          This field indicates if an enemy is detected.
